meanings.definition: The quality or state of being shadowy.
meanings.sent1: The shadowinesses of the forest made it feel mysterious and eerie.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with shadowinesses as the sun set outside.
meanings.sent3: The shadowinesses of the old attic made it a perfect hiding spot for hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were shrouded in shadowinesses, making it hard for others to understand her.
meanings.sent5: The shadowinesses of the cave seemed to whisper ancient secrets to those who dared to enter.

meanings.definition: The presence of shadows or darkness.
meanings.sent1: The shadowinesses in the alley made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The shadowinesses of the night enveloped the city in a blanket of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The shadowinesses of the room played tricks on her eyes, making her see things that weren't there.
meanings.sent4: His mind was clouded by shadowinesses, unable to see the light of reason.
meanings.sent5: The shadowinesses of the forest at night seemed to dance and sway with a life of their own.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be obscured or hidden from view.
meanings.sent1: The shadowinesses of the figure made it impossible to identify who it was.
meanings.sent2: The shadowinesses of the fog obscured the path ahead, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The shadowinesses of the situation kept everyone guessing about what was really going on.
meanings.sent4: Her true feelings were hidden in the shadowinesses of her smile.
meanings.sent5: The shadowinesses of the painting gave it an air of mystery and intrigue.
